title: Sweet Chili Salmon Tacos with Green Apple Salsa
directions: To make the salsa, toss together the lemon juice, lime juice, honey, apples, onion, green pepper and cilantro in a medium bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste and reserve.
Warm sweet chili salmon in a skillet, microwave or oven until heated through.

In a dry large skillet, warm tortillas one a few at a time over medium heat. Toast the tortillas for about 30 seconds to a minute on each side. Hold the warm tortillas in wrapped in a towel until ready to build tacos.
To build, crumble about 3 ounces of salmon into large pieces into each tortilla. Top with about 2-4 tablespoons of salsa on each taco, add sauce and serve.
ingredients: 1 Granny Smith apple, cut into matchsticks
Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
2 tsp Sriracha depending on how spicy you prefer
